    • Method Detail

      • append

        public ITimestamp append(Serializable payload,
                         Set<UUID> ustreams)
                  throws OutOfSpaceException,
                         IOException
        Description copied from interface: IStream
        Append an object to the stream, along with the set of other objects to which the payload is relevant. This method is deprecated because it represents a way to support multi-object operations (in support of txns) that is too tightly coupled with the stream interface. To wit: what sense does it make for a stream to append things for more than one stream. TODO: FIXME: This will be refactored into a transaction layer at some point in the future.
        Specified by:
        append in interface IStream
        ustreams - A list of streams ids to which the given payload applies.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • append

        public ITimestamp append(Serializable payload)
                  throws OutOfSpaceException,
                         IOException
        Description copied from interface: IStream
        Append an object to the stream. This operation may or may not be successful. For example, a move operation may occur, and the append will not be part of the stream.
        Specified by:
        append in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        payload - A serializable object to append to the stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • readNextEntry

        public IStreamEntry readNextEntry()
                           throws HoleEncounteredException,
                                  TrimmedException,
                                  IOException
        Description copied from interface: IStream
        Read the next entry in the stream as a IStreamEntry. This function retrieves the next entry in the stream, or null, if there are no more entries in the stream.
        Specified by:
        readNextEntry in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A CorfuDBStreamEntry containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException

      • getCurrentPosition

        public ITimestamp getCurrentPosition()
        Gets the current position the stream has read to (which may not point to an entry in the stream).
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPosition in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently read address in the stream.

      • trim

        public void trim(ITimestamp address)
        Requests a trim on this stream. This function informs the configuration master that the position on this stream is trimmable, and moves the start position of this stream to the new position.
        Specified by:
        trim in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        address -

      • check

        public ITimestamp check(boolean cached)
        Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Specified by:
        check in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        cached - Whether or not the timestamp returned is cached.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream, or currently read, depending on whether cached is set or not.
